data.name: Mumbai University of Economic Sciences
data.description: The primary mission of the University of Mumbai University of Economic Science is the education of the state’s citizens through teaching, research, creative activity, and community engagement. Among India’s oldest and most comprehensive public universities, MUES is the major research institution in South India, enrolling approximately 21,000 undergraduate students and approximately 8,000 students in graduate and professional programs. At the heart of its mission lies the University’s responsibility to state and society to promote the dissemination of knowledge, cultural enrichment, and an enhanced quality of life.
data.slogan: As a Gamecock, your inspiration will have No Limits.

data.description: On top of being one of the best university in South America, La Universidad Pcifico de Buenos Aires is rich in traditions and diversity is part of its DNA. Every year, hundreds of international students from over 60 countries study with us. Our rich multi-cultural environment ensures that our students benefit from holistic education and develop global perspectives.

data.name: Jakarta Bhasha University
data.description: We started out as a modest medical school in 1905, founded by a determined group of businessmen led by Tanu Kam, to serve the needs of the local community. Today, we are Indonesia’s flagship university consistently ranked first in Asia and among the leading universities in the world. Our focus will centre on nurturing future-ready graduates, enhancing our research's translational impact and making JBU Asia's most vibrant university enterprise ecosystem. Our goal? More distinctive, high-impact value for Indonesia and the world.
data.slogan: A leading global university centred in Asia, influencing the future

data.name: University of Guadalajara
data.description: The University of Guadalajara was founded on 22 September 1910 by Juan el Primero Fuentes, former Minister of Education who sought to create a very different institution from its 19th-century precursor, the Royal and Pontifical University of Guadalajara, which had been founded on 21 September 1551 by a royal decree signed by Crown Prince Phillip on behalf of Charles I of Spain and brought to a definitive closure in 1865 by Maximilian I of Mexico. Instead of reviving what he saw as an anachronistic institution with strong ties to the Roman Catholic Church, he aimed to create a new university, secular in nature and national in scope, that could reorganize higher education within the country, serve as a model of positivism and encompass the ideas of the dominant Mexican liberalism.

data.name: Institute of Higher Education of Accra
data.description: The Institute of Higher Education of Accra is proudly the oldest and largest of the thirteen Ghanaian universities and tertiary institutions. It was founded in 1948 as the University College of the Gold Coast, and was originally an affiliate college of the University of London which supervised its academic programmes and awarded degrees. It gained full university status in 1961, and now has nearly 40,000 students. The original emphasis was on the liberal arts, social sciences, basic science, agriculture, and medicine, but (partly as the result of a national educational reform programme) the curriculum was expanded to provide more technology-based and vocational courses and postgraduate training.

data.name: Johannesburg Business School
data.description: The roots of Johannesburg Business School lie in the establishment of the South African College in 1985 as a school for created by mainly inverstors. In 1874 the South African College Schools, teaching up to secondary level, were separated from the College, which prepared students for the examinations of the University of the Cape of Good Hope. In 1887 the first male residence in Southern Africa was established, known as College House Residence, under the initiative of Professor C.E. Lewis. In 1918 the South African College was elevated to full university status with the power to award degrees, and renamed the Johannesburg Business School.

data.name: Oslo NordenBoerg University
data.description: The Oslo NordenBoerg University is the oldest university in Norway, located in the beautiful Norwegian capital of Oslo. Until 1 January 2016 it was the largest Norwegian institution of higher education in terms of size, and we are proud of having led the way for our country which has a long reputation for excellence. The Academic Ranking of World Universities has ranked it the 58th best university in the world and the third best in the Nordic countries. In 2015, the Times Higher Education World University Rankings ranked it the 135th best university in the world and the seventh best in the Nordics.
data.slogan: Reaching self-excellence is the very first step

data.name: Paris Louis XIV University
data.description: Paris Louis XIV University is one of the most prestigious institution in France dedicated to the study of literature, languages, civilizations, arts, humanities and social sciences is located on the original medieval foundations, and now extends to the Latin Quarter and to other areas in Paris. The University is characterized by rich culture and tradition with top-quality researchers. Its excellent scientific reputation is demonstrated by regular publications and international exchanges. Paris Louis XIV University seeks to constantly adapt to present-day social and technological changes and to encourage as many students as possible to study at Paris-Sorbonne while preparing for their future careers. We incites its students to think freely, to construct their own judgment so that they can become responsible and inventive citizens who can promote dignity and a culture of peace.
data.slogan: The best risk is the one that we do not take

data.name: Sydney School of Applied Arts
data.description: Sydney School of Applied Arts was established as a College in 1976 of Advanced Education and enrolled its first students when it took over responsibility for design diploma courses previously conducted by the Department of Technical and Further Education. A visual arts program was offered by SCA the following year. Today we are proud to represent one of the country's elite school in the art field and we encourage young high school graduates that have the potential and the passion for creation to share their art with us and allow us to take it to the next step: a career!
data.slogan: Your heart is where it comes from

data.name: Universidade Carioca Do Rio de Janeiro
data.description: Highly regarded as one of the best University in the whole South America, Universidade Carioca do Rio de Janeiro was founded in 1934, regrouping already existing schools in the state of Rio de Janeiro, such as the Faculdade de Direito do Largo de São Francisco (Law), the Polytechnic School (Engineering) and the Escola Superior de Agricultura Luiz de Queiroz (Agriculture). The university has subsequently created new departments, becoming one of the largest institutions of higher education in Latin America, with approximately 90,000 enrolled students. Currently, it has eleven campuses, four of them in the city of Rio. The remaining campuses are in the cities of Bauru, Lorena, Piracicaba, Pirassununga, Ribeirão Preto and two in São Carlos.
data.slogan: Be the change that you want to see

data.name: Kobe School of Business and Development
data.description: The origins of the Kobe School of Business and Development go back to Kobe Commercial High School, founded in 1965. It began to have a class under the title of “Business and Development” in 1986. The school upgraded in 1989 and what is is today. Starting from being one of the very first school of business administration in Japan, it has now one of the most successful job placement rate in the country. The stone monument erected in the front yard of the main building in Kokusai campus commemorates this history with the inscription, “Our country’s study of business administration began here.

data.name: King Al-Jawa Islamic University
data.description: King Al-Jawa Islamic University is proudly one of the oldest and most inovative yet respectful of its traditions amongst Saudi Schoolsl. It was founded in 1948 as the by King Abdulaziz, and was originally an affiliate college of the University of London which supervised its academic programmes and awarded degrees. It gained full university status in 1961, and now has nearly 40,000 students. The original emphasis was on the liberal arts, social sciences, basic science, agriculture, and medicine, but (partly as the result of a national educational reform programme) the curriculum was expanded to provide more technology-based and vocational courses and postgraduate training.

data.name: Saint Petersbourg Youth Dedicated College
data.description: We believe students are the heart of SPC! All SPC resources, decisions, and efforts are aligned to transform students’ lives to empower them to finish what they start! We promote academic excellence through interactive, innovative, and inquiry-centered teaching and learning. We commit to a culture where excellent service is expected and delivered by all SPC employees. We foster a learning community in which the values, goals, and learning styles of all students and members of the college community are recognized and supported.

data.name: Shangai Imperial University
data.description: Shanghai Imperial University (SIU), as one of the higher education institutions which enjoy a long history and a world-renowned reputation in China, is a key university directly under the administration of the Ministry of Education (MOE) of the People's Republic of China and co-constructed by MOE and Shanghai Municipal Government. Through 120 years' unremitting efforts, SJTU has become a comprehensive, research-oriented, and internationalized top university in China.
data.slogan: What is happening today is what will become tomorrow
